body: your input components are both required.

Sorry Bill, but I think you misunderstood. I know that the dynamic fields are required. The problem is that, if you follow the steps that I provided, RHF will think that the dynamic fields are not required.
because we do not `unregiseter` input after unmount. read the doc on `shouldUnregister`.
Yeah, shouldUnregister is set to true.
@bluebill1049 can you investigate this further please?
hey @wtchnm should have been fixed last night with this commit https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/pull/6053
Hey @bluebill1049, unfortunately not, but I can confirm that the problem is with the Controller: https://codesandbox.io/s/rhf-register-el146
It's not even released. Will get it released this weekend.
@bluebill1049 yes I know, I cloned the react-hook-form repo, built and tested it via `yarn link`.

i don't get the issue in here.

select: required
input: required
input: required

- when you mount select required but empty, so false
- select married false
- when you select single, it's correct to be **true** right?
  - select: required (pass) the other two inputs are unmounted

To reproduce you have to do the following:

1. Set the marital status to single. The form is valid.
2. Set the marital status to married. The form is invalid.
3. Set the marital status to single. The form is valid.
4. Set the marital status to married. The form is still valid. This is the problem.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10513364/126850930-e37e6dae-46ae-4c9b-993f-c0b7df435611.mov

are you sure you are using the latest code?
Oh, this is the sandbox that I created using register. This works. The one that not works is using Controller: https://codesandbox.io/s/rhf-controller-l00mp. Sorry for the confusion.
